Description: Clay sealing around a roll of blackened cloth. A sealing from a document with the impression of the papyrus to which it was attached and the remains of the textile strip, which bound the packet. The clay of the sealing was impressed five times with the same intaglio gem, a profile head of Isis. Micaceous grey-brown Nile mud, unfired; the textile is now dark brown.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV The image of Isis is apparently the one used also on Terracotta 3623. The fabric has been identified by Hero Granger-Taylor as an S-spin linen, a simple tabby weave, originally yellowish and undyed.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3624)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Davidson Beazley
